original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //

analyzed: shed bdag yongs su dag pas don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su dag pa /

analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su dag pas shed bdag yongs su dag pa ste /

analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: shed bdag yongs su dag pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de /

analyzed: gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //
translated: nor are they divided.

analyzed: shed bdag yongs su dag pas 'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su dag pa /

analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su dag pas @237a *//

analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: shed bdag yongs su dag pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de /

analyzed: gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //

analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yongs su dag pas shed bdag yongs su dag pa ste /

analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: shed bdag yongs su dag pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de /
translated: the purity of the self of the individual and the purity of the emptiness of the unconditioned are not two,üîΩare not divided, are not broken apart, and do not become separate.

analyzed: de ltar na; shed bdag yongs su dag pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de /
